meanings.sent1: The movie's overblown special effects were too much for the young audience.
meanings.sent2: Her overblown reaction to the small mistake made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The overblown cake decoration looked like a giant, colorful cloud.
meanings.sent4: His overblown promises of grandeur left everyone skeptical.
meanings.sent5: The overblown balloon popped loudly, startling the children.

meanings.sent1: The wind had overblown the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent2: She had overblown the situation, causing unnecessary panic.
meanings.sent3: The storm overblown, the sun shone brightly once again.
meanings.sent4: His anger overblown, he realized he had overreacted.
meanings.sent5: The rumors had overblown, becoming wild tales of adventure.

meanings.definition: To inflate or exaggerate beyond the truth
meanings.sent1: The politician overblown his achievements to win votes.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overblown stories to make them more interesting.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman overblown the size of the fish he caught.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were overblown, trying to cover up his mistake.
meanings.sent5: The news article overblown the severity of the storm, causing unnecessary panic.
